found this game through reddit while looking for dark and depressing horror games and i was not disappointed the narrative was incredible covering some intense topics the atmosphere was oppressive in the best way and the slower pace was daunting without being a headache the mechanics arent perfect by any means but it somehow makes the character of the game feel more correct with the story the game is trying to tell if abject grief is your thing give this game a shot

this was a lovely game in 2012 and still holds up well 13 years later the game handles mature themes well and susan is an incredibly realistic depiction of depression the controls can feel a little clunky and youll be disappointed if you go into it expecting an exciting horror experience aside from a bit of cheap gore this game delivers quiet horror  contemplative with a slow creeping sense of unease that weighs on your emotions rather than your nervous system
